conclusion: Plan to solve step-by-step to find the time it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder.
A 5m wooden rod is suspended from a fixed point and released from rest to fall freely.
The rod must pass through cylinder AB positioned 20m below the suspension point and the cylinder is 5m tall.
Need to find time t₁ when the rod passes through point A (upper end of cylinder) using g = 10 m/s².
When the bottom end of the rod reaches point A, the rod has fallen a distance of 15m.
Using the free fall equation, the time t when the bottom end reaches point A is t = √3s ≈ 1.732s.
The rod completely passes through point A when its top end falls a total distance of 20m.
Using the free fall equation, the time t when the top end passes point A is t = 2s.
The time t₁ it takes for the rod to pass through point A is t₁ = 2s - √3s ≈ 0.268s.
The time t₁ it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder is 0.268 seconds (or exactly 2 - √3 seconds).
